intro: Erigeron gunnii, commonly known as the alpine blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron gunnii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
